snippet: Voters in the St. Louis suburb turned down part of a tax increase package that city leaders had described as essential for carrying out a legal settlement with the Justice Department.
abstract: Ferguson, Mo, residents vote to reject property tax increase, part of package city lawmakers said was needed to fund federally-mandated overhaul of police department overhaul; deal with Justice Dept followed investigation spurred by  fatal shooting of unarmed black teenager by a white police officer in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Voters in the St. Louis suburb turned down part of a tax increase package that city leaders had described as essential for carrying out a legal settlement with the Justice Department.

headline.main: Ferguson Voters Give Split Result on Funding Police Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Voters Give Split Result on Funding Police Overhaul
